metadata.name: Compatibility Matrix Dataset
metadata.description: Relationship compatibility data based on BaZi principles for analyzing romantic, business, and friendship compatibility
metadata.author: FatePath BaZi Master

data.description: Jia (Wood) and Yi (Wood) create natural harmony through shared element. Both are yang Wood, creating strong mutual understanding.
data.advice: Embrace similarities while maintaining individual identity. Focus on personal growth together.

data.description: Jia (Wood) generates Bing (Fire) in the natural cycle. This creates a nurturing, supportive relationship dynamic.
data.advice: Maintain healthy boundaries. The Wood person should support without controlling, Fire person should appreciate without taking for granted.

data.description: Jia (Wood) controls Wu (Earth) in the natural cycle. This creates tension and potential power struggles.
data.advice: Learn to compromise and find balance. Focus on mutual respect and understanding rather than control.

data.description: Yi (Wood) generates Bing (Fire), creating a natural nurturing relationship. Yin Wood provides gentle support to yang Fire.
data.advice: Maintain passion and excitement. Don't take the natural harmony for granted.

data.description: Yi (Wood) generates Ding (Fire), creating a supportive relationship. Yin Wood nurtures yin Fire gently.
data.advice: Add excitement and passion to the relationship. Don't rely solely on natural harmony.

data.description: Bing (Fire) generates Wu (Earth), creating a warm, nurturing relationship. Fire provides energy and warmth to Earth.
data.advice: Fire should moderate intensity, Earth should provide grounding. Balance energy and stability.

data.description: Bing (Fire) generates Ji (Earth), creating a supportive relationship. Yang Fire energizes yin Earth.
data.advice: Fire should be patient, Earth should be more active. Find middle ground in energy levels.

data.description: Ding (Fire) generates Wu (Earth), creating a gentle nurturing relationship. Yin Fire provides gentle warmth to yang Earth.
data.advice: Add variety and excitement. Don't become complacent with the natural harmony.

data.description: Ding (Fire) generates Ji (Earth), creating a harmonious relationship. Yin Fire nurtures yin Earth gently.
data.advice: Maintain individual interests and add variety. Don't become too dependent on each other.

data.description: Wu (Earth) generates Geng (Metal), creating a strong foundation for growth. Earth provides stability for Metal's structure.
data.advice: Add fun and spontaneity. Don't become too focused on structure and planning.

compatibilityRules.generation: Elements that generate each other create natural harmony and support
compatibilityRules.control: Elements that control each other create tension and challenges
compatibilityRules.harmony: Same elements create understanding but may lack complementary balance
compatibilityRules.conflict: Opposing elements create dynamic tension that requires work to balance

interpretationGuidelines.highScore: Scores 8-10 indicate strong natural compatibility with minimal effort required
interpretationGuidelines.mediumScore: Scores 6-7 indicate good compatibility with some work needed
interpretationGuidelines.lowScore: Scores 4-5 indicate challenging compatibility requiring significant effort
interpretationGuidelines.veryLowScore: Scores 1-3 indicate difficult compatibility that may not be sustainable long-term

relationshipAdvice.romantic: Focus on emotional connection and mutual growth
relationshipAdvice.business: Emphasize complementary skills and shared goals
relationshipAdvice.friendship: Build on common interests and mutual support
